text:
SPEAKER: We are essentially
public trustees that

have been given
the responsibility

to use these
resources, but use them

in a manner that is
judicious and is responsible

and in a manner that ensures
that we address issues not just

about the present, but
also the future generations
that come after us.

So it is that responsible
lending becomes critical.

It's not just a question
of lending money.

I mean, but you have
to ask yourself,

the entity to which
you are lending,

what is it going to be
using this money for?

You then have to
be asking yourself,

the question is whether
the money that you lend

is going to be used for purposes
of sustaining development

in a manner that speaks to that
responsible use of resources.

And that is why, as part of
our civic responsibility,

we have been engaging with the
banks in Kenya, for example,

to say issues around sustainable
development are overarching.

And there is no
bank that is going

to be lending money to
an entity that is not

going to be involved in an
activity that is going to be
impacting on the environment.
